definition: an eye for beauty/aesthetic judgment
to examine/to investigate/carefully/to try (in court)
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up

sentences.english: Lots of Libra people are artistic and appreciate beautiful things.
sentences.chinese: 許多天平座人都很有藝術細胞而和審美眼光。

sentences.english: To her aesthetic vision, we can boast about.
sentences.chinese: 對於她的審美眼光，我們可不敢恭維。

sentences.english: She has good taste in clothes.
sentences.chinese: 她對服裝有的審美眼光。

sentences.english: You have an eye for beauty.
That sounds like a good idea. You have a good eye for beautiful things.
sentences.chinese: 似乎是個好主意，你的審美眼光不錯。

sentences.english: Aesthetic taste and the level of technic refrains the handicraftTujia brocade .
sentences.chinese: 審美眼光和技巧的高低制約着織錦工藝水平。
